  • Method Details

    • writeResizedMatrixToTiffFile

      public static void writeResizedMatrixToTiffFile​(Number[][] matrix, File file, au.edu.anu.ymuit.ui.colour.Palette palette, fr.ens.biologie.generic.utils.Interval range, int magnification, int bufferImageType, int imageScalingMethod, IsMissingValue isMissingValue, javafx.scene.paint.Color bkgColor)
      Write a 2-D Number[][] array to a tif file, optionally using a magnification factor.
      Parameters:
      matrix - The Number[][] matrix to save
      file - Full file name
      palette - Palette to use.
      range - The Interval range for mapping the data to the palette entries.
      magnification - Size increase in image output.
      bufferImageType - The BufferedImage type constant.
      imageScalingMethod - The Image scaling method constant.
      bkgColor - Colour used when value is considered a missing value.
      isMissingValue - Enum to determine if a value is a missing value IsMissingValue.

    • resize

      public static BufferedImage resize​(BufferedImage img, double factor, int imageScalingMethod, int BufferType)
      Resize a by an integer factor.
      Parameters:
      img - The original image.
      factor - Rescaling factor
      imageScalingMethod - One of Image constants.
      BufferType - One of BufferedImage constants.
      Returns:
      The rescaled image.
      See Also:
      scaling a tiff file.

    • getUniqueExperimentSubdirectoryName

      public static String getUniqueExperimentSubdirectoryName​(String root, String baseName)
      Create unique sub-directory name below the given root directory by adding an integer to the baseName.
      Parameters:
      root - The root directory.
      baseName - The name to be modified.
      Returns:
      Unique sub-directory name (wigetID <n>).

    • getXFDescriptor

      public static String getXFDescriptor​(List<au.edu.anu.rscs.aot.graph.property.Property> properties, Map<String,​au.edu.anu.twcore.experiment.ExpFactor> factors)
      Create a unique artifact name for a single simulator in a cross-factorial design.
      Parameters:
      properties - Property list of a simulator.
      factors - Experiment factors.
      Returns:
      String describing the factor levels used, e.g. distance(long)_habitatPattern(coarse)

    • generateANOVAScript

      public static List<String> generateANOVAScript​(File inFile, Map<String,​au.edu.anu.twcore.experiment.ExpFactor> factors, List<au.edu.anu.twcore.experiment.ExpFactor> orderedFactors, String responseVariableName, String resultsName)
      Generate an script for ANOVA analysis.
      Parameters:
      inFile - The input file name (tab separated with header and '.' decimal separator).
      factors - Factor details (ExpFactor).
      orderedFactors -
      responseVariableName - The name of the response variable. The input file must name the response variable as "RV".
      resultsName - The file name for the results table.
      Returns:
      Lines of text for the script.

    • generateBoxPlotScript

      public static List<String> generateBoxPlotScript​(File inFile, Map<String,​au.edu.anu.twcore.experiment.ExpFactor> factors, List<au.edu.anu.twcore.experiment.ExpFactor> orderedFactors, String rv)
      Generate an R script that will produce a box plot showing the overall trends in the response variable for each of the experiment factors.
      Parameters:
      inFile - The file path of the data file.
      factors - The experiment factor details ExpFactor.
      orderedFactors -
      rv - The response variable name.
      Returns:
      The script as a list of strings.

    • generateRVEPlotScript

      public static List<String> generateRVEPlotScript​(File inFile, String rv)
      Generate an R script to create a barplot of the relative variance of the response variable explained by treatments.
      Parameters:
      inFile - The data file of relative variance explained
      rv - Name of the response variable.
      Returns:
      Script as a list of strings.

    • saveAndExecuteScript

      public static boolean saveAndExecuteScript​(File scriptFile, List<String> lines)
      Saves an R script to file then executes the script with Rscript. This method waits for the execution to finish before returning.
      Parameters:
      scriptFile - The file and path name of the script.
      lines - An array of lines of the script.
